net.kuujo.vertigo.rpc

Interface PollingExecutor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Component, Executor<PollingExecutor>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultPollingExecutor

    public interface PollingExecutor
extends Executor<PollingExecutor>
    A polling executor. The polling executor reads input from code by periodically polling a handler for new data. If the execute handler fails to emit new data when polled, the executor will reschedule the next execution for a period in the near future.
    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Method Detail

      • setExecuteDelay

        PollingExecutor setExecuteDelay(long delay)
        Sets the execute delay. The execute delay indicates the interval at which the executor will attempt to poll the execute handler for new data.
        Parameters:
        delay - The empty execute delay.
        Returns:
        The called executor instance.

      • getExecuteDelay

        long getExecuteDelay()
        Gets the execute delay. The execute delay indicates the interval at which the executor will attempt to poll the execute handler for new data.
        Returns:
        The empty executor delay.

      • executeHandler

        PollingExecutor executeHandler(org.vertx.java.core.Handler<PollingExecutor> handler)
        Sets an execute handler. The execute handler will be periodically polled for new data. Each time the execute handler is polled only a single message should be emitted. This allows the executor to maintain control over the flow of data. If the execute handler is called but fails to emit any new messages to the network, the executor will reschedule the next call to the handler for a period in the near future.
        Parameters:
        handler - A handler to be invoked for executing the network.
        Returns:
        The called executor instance.
